alert.note: Alert for Elliott; Magoffin; Morgan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 2:36PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Morgan, northwestern Magoffin and southwestern Elliott Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 236 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lick Branch, or near West Liberty, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Little Sandy around 240 PM EDT. Gordon Ford around 245 PM EDT. Lenox around 250 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Steele, Elamton, Elkfork, Jeptha, Crockett, Cottle, Florress, Dingus, Logville and Haleburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
